Utile pour les parents, baby-sitter ou animateur en crèche, puériculture etc.<br><br>La peur des monstres est un phénomène bien connu des parents qui élèvent leurs enfants. C'est l’une des plus répandues chez nos enfants, et elle persiste sur plusieurs années dès le plus jeune âge avec un pic vers 3-4 ans. En tant que parent il est regrettable d'entendre les enfants appeler à l'aide dans la nuit, effrayés et ne pouvant s'endormir correctement.<br><br>Les difficultés liées au couchage des enfants ou à leur sommeil sont problématiques pour toute la famille. Pourtant, dire que « les monstres n’existent pas » n’aide pas les enfants. Dans 99% des cas les monstres existent réellement dans leur esprit. Ils empoisonnent leur vie, trouble leur sommeil ou leur fait faire des cauchemars.<br><br>Leur dire « mais non, les monstres n’existent pas ! » ne les rassure pas, parce que pour eux ces monstres sont bien là. Cela risquerait même de vous faire perdre en crédibilité. Leur présenter un jouet attrape-monstre ou un spray anti-monstre ne ferait qu’accentuer le bien-fondé de leur peur et diminuer la confiance qu’ils ont en vous.<br><br>Il faut au contraire les aider à faire la différence entre le réel et l’imaginaire. Cette application permet de ""prouver"" de manière fictive que la réalité est en adéquation avec votre discours niant l'existence ou la présence d'indésirables. <br><br>Reconnaître la peur de nos enfants permet de rétablir le lien avec eux car pour eux, il y a vraiment un monstre qui peut se cacher n'importe où. La première astuce consiste donc à l'accepter au lieu de la nier. Leur faire réaliser de manière compréhensive qu'ils n'ont pas de raison de s'inquiéter va les aider à s'apaiser.<br><br>Comment ça marche ? Appuyez sur ""démarrer l'analyse"" sur l'écran d'accueil. L'application simule un radar puis affiche le résultat ""0 monstre détecté"".<br><br>Conseil d'utilisation : Utilisez cet outil comme un appui à votre discours, en dernier recours, pour ""prouver"" que l'enfant a raison de vous faire confiance en ce qui concerne l'absence de monstre, et que ses peurs ne sont pas fondées.<br>Evitez de laisser l'enfant manipuler l'appareil lui-même, vous restez maitre de la situation. Exposez l'enfant le moins possible face à l'écran lumineux, ce qui risque de trop le stimuler avant le coucher.<br><br>Si cet outil vous a plu, n’hésitez pas à le partager avec vos proches !<br><br>Note : Cette application est un outil fictif qui simule un radar et n'est basé sur aucune étude médicale ou scientifique. "healthy.baby.food"	"Baby Food"	"5000"	"4"	"<div jsname=""sngebd"">In this Baby food app, You can find Healthy Recipes for Your Baby.<br><br>Baby food is any soft, easily consumed food, other than breast milk or infant formula, that is made specifically for babies, roughly between the ages of four to six months and two years. The food comes in multiple varieties and tastes; it may be table food that the rest of the family is eating that has been mashed or otherwise broken down.<br><br>Healthy Baby foods are either a soft, liquid paste or an easily chewed food since babies lack developed muscles and teeth to effectively chew. Babies typically move to consuming healthy baby food once nursing or formula is not sufficient for the child's appetite. Babies do not need to have teeth to transition to eating solid foods. Teeth, however, normally do begin to show up at this age. Care should be taken with certain foods that pose a choking hazard, such as undercooked vegetables, grapes, or food that may contain bones. Babies begin eating liquid style baby food consisting of pureed vegetables and fruits, sometimes mixed with rice cereal and formula, or breastmilk.<br><br>The first meal of the day has to be nourishing. It should have ample calories to give your little one a kickstart for the day. A breakfast recipe for babies should be a healthy mix of taste and nutrition. While there are several breakfast ideas for babies, it can get a bit challenging to make a new breakfast menu every day.<br><br>We tell you about the various healthy breakfast foods for babies and the processes involved in making them.<br><br>First, let’s take a brief look at the importance of breakfast.<br><br>Why Is Breakfast Important?<br><br>Breakfast is crucial for babies for the same reason it is for adults. It provides calories for initiating body’s metabolic processes. Even if your baby is fed in the middle of the night, his body would have surely depleted the resources by morning.<br><br>Learning some breakfast recipes will let you know what exactly you need to make in the morning.<br><br>15 Healthy Breakfast Recipes For Babies<br><br>These are some amazing breakfast ideas for your baby’s menu. The good news is that if yours is truly low, there are plenty of ways to increase milk supply. The best news? Chances are, your milk supply is actually just fine.<br><br>If you’re exclusively breastfeeding and baby is on target for healthy weight gain, your milk supply is likely a-okay, and there’s no need to increase breast milk production—even if baby seems famished or fussy. "io.ionic.startera"	"ELFE.Online"	"500"	"5"	"<div jsname=""sngebd"">ELFE steht für Einfach Leistungen für Eltern und soll in wenigen Jahren die Behördengänge rund um das Ereignis Geburt ablösen. <br><br>Wir, die Freie Hansestadt Bremen, denken den Prozess für Eltern rund um das Ereignis Geburt, also Geburtsurkunde, Kindergeld und Elterngeld, neu. Statt Ihre Zeit mit dem Ausfüllen von komplizierten Anträgen und auf Ämtern zu verschwenden, sollten Sie sich nach der Geburt Ihres Kindes nur um dieses und Ihre Familie kümmern dürfen.<br> <br>Dies ermöglicht Ihnen die App ELFE.online. Die Idee ist, dass die ohnehin bei den Behörden bekannten Daten nicht erneut von uns angefragt und von Ihnen angegeben werden müssen. Stattdessen erteilen Sie uns in der App eine Einwilligung und wir werden durch das Zusammenstellen der benötigten Daten für Sie tätig. Das geschieht völlig transparent und nachvollziehbar, so dass Sie jederzeit die Kontrolle über Ihre Daten haben. Ihr Vorteil ist somit, dass Sie viel weniger tun müssen als bisher und zudem sicher sein können, jeweils die korrekte Summe an Leistungen zu erhalten.<br><br>Die aktuelle Testversion der App stellt zunächst nur unsere Idee für das Elterngeld vor. Wir bitten dazu um Ihr Feedback. Dieses fließt in unsere Weiterentwicklungen ein, so dass wir Ihnen hoffentlich bald den Service rund um das Ereignis Geburt tatsächlich per App zur Verfügung stellen können. Bis dahin bitten wir um Beachtung, dass noch keine echten Elterngeldanträge gestellt werden können. Auch die Eingabe der Daten über den neuen Personalausweis wird simuliert.<br><br>Bei Interesse, können Sie Ihre E-Mail-Adresse angeben und erhalten eine Empfangsbestätigung sowie einen Musterbescheid.</div>"	"0.00"	"Parenting"	"1"

baby(ニナルベビー、になるべびー)をご覧いただき、ありがとうございます。<br><br>日々成長していく赤ちゃんに寄り添えることは、ママにとってかけがえのない時間です。<br><br>しかし、特に初産の場合、赤ちゃんのちょっとした反応や変化に戸惑ったり、人に相談できずに独りで抱えてしまったりするママも多くいます。<br><br>ninaru babyは、『絶対にママの味方であり続ける』アプリをめざして、メッセージ、デザイン、設計に想いを込めました。<br><br>ママと赤ちゃんの生活がもっともっと笑顔で溢れるように、毎日のお世話の悩みに応える情報を丁寧にお届けしていきます。<br><br>みなさまの育児・子育てのお役に立てれば幸いです。<br>もしご利用頂けましたら、ご感想もお待ちしております。<br><br><br>■ アプリに不具合・問題がある場合<br>アプリを起動することが出来ましたら、アプリ内の設定からお問い合わせください。<br>もしもアプリを起動することが出来なくなった場合、以下のメールアドレスまでご連絡ください。<br>ninaru-baby@eversense.co.jp<br><br><br>※ninarubabyで配信される記事は、弊社が運営するWebサイト「こそだてハック（こそだてはっく）」と同様のものもございます<br><br>＊ninaruは、2018年8月13日にGooglePlay医療ランキングで1位を獲得しました</div>"	"0.00"	"Parenting"	"2690"

かわいい胎児のイラスト<br>毎週変わるので赤ちゃんの成長を目で見て感じられる！エコー写真と違った良さがありますよ。（20週以降は毎日）<br><br>●「今日の赤ちゃん」「今日のパパへ」<br>出産まで毎日メッセージが届くから、プレパパにも安心。<br><br>● 妊娠週数にあわせた「今日の記事」<br>パパに知ってほしい情報や役立つ情報を毎日配信。<br><br>● ママや先輩パパからのアドバイス<br>ママの本音や先輩パパからのメッセージも届くから、やるべきことがわかる。<br><br>● 全体像がすぐ分かる「妊娠スケジュール」<br>妊娠中から出産まで、いつ頃に何をすればいいのか先を見通せる。<br>また、出産当日の流れ（陣痛開始〜出産まで）も詳しく確認できるので、事前の準備にも役立つ。<br><br><br>【育児モード（新機能）】<br>●今日のパパへのメッセージ or 「〇〇パパへ」<br>2歳までは毎日、2〜4歳までは週1で、赤ちゃんの成長やママの体・悩みについてメッセージが届くから、はじめての育児も安心。<br><br>● 赤ちゃんの月齢にあわせた「今日の記事」<br>赤ちゃんのお世話やしつけ、産後のママの体などに関する記事を毎日配信。<br><br>● "net.cleverbit.Nature"	"Nature for Kids - Flashcards"	"10000"	"4.7"	"<div jsname=""sngebd"">“Nature for Kids,” from the series “Words for Kids,” is a game that promotes the development of children between 2 and 4 years of age.<br><br>Together with your child, you can watch wonderful images of natural objects and phenomena, seasons, fruits and vegetables, berries, flowers, and mushrooms, all while learning their names! <br><br>The carefully selected photographs will not only help a child learn the names of various natural objects and phenomena, but also expose him or her to the remarkable beauty of the world in which we live!<br><br>After the child has looked through all the flashcards, he or she can take a fun quiz to see how many of the words he or she knows. Regardless of the number of correct answers given, and of stars earned, the child's developing skills will be fostered by enthusiastic applause and floating balloons!<br><br>The educational flashcards for tots are divided into the following categories: berries, fruits, vegetables, flowers, mushrooms, the environment (sea, island, forest, river, mountain, etc.), the seasons, and natural phenomena (rain, rainbow, sunset, lightning, etc.). <br><br>One important feature makes this educational app stand out from the rest: instead of drawings, which are not always easy to identify, the child will see beautiful, colorful photographs of each object and phenomenon. <br><br>Clearly, it is not so easy to show real live lightning, rainbow or erupting volcano to a child. This educational app allows the child to “see” many natural objects and phenomena as they appear in reality, while allowing parents to tell the child more about them. <br><br>Does the youngster have an older brother or sister in grade school? They can also use this educational game! Besides English, this app also supports the German, Russian and Ukrainian languages. <br><br>While playing with flashcards in a foreign language, a school-age child can effortlessly learn many new words with which to surprise their foreign language teachers and classmates. An A+ is sure to follow! <br><br>In order to use this educational app, the youngster does not need to be able to read. The simple interface and spoken clues allow even the youngest of children to play and learn independently!<br><br>Experience has shown that children love to look through a series of colorful pictures with sounds, and they will ask to see them again and again. According to Glenn Doman, an American physical therapist and the founder of The Institutes for the Achievement of Human Potential, participating in these kinds of educational activities (for 5-10 minutes a day) stimulates the development of various regions in the brain. As a result, the child's photographic memory takes shape, the child develops much faster than his or her peers, and, beginning at infancy, the child gains access to a world of encyclopedic knowledge. <br><br>The main point, in which Doman is undoubtedly correct, is that the younger a child, the more easily he or she can absorb new knowledge. It's important to make use of this ability while it's available!</div>"	"2.99"	"Parenting"	"1192"

According to Glenn Doman, an American physical therapist and the founder of The Institutes for the Achievement of Human Potential, participating in these kinds of educational activities (for 5-10 minutes a day) stimulates the development of various regions in the brain. As a result, the child's photographic memory takes shape, the child develops much faster than his or her peers, and, beginning at infancy, the child gains access to a world of encyclopedic knowledge. <br><br>The main point, in which Doman is undoubtedly correct, is that the younger a child, the more easily he or she can absorb new knowledge. "org.twisevictory.jp"	"メンタルリープのアプリ：ワンダーウィーク"	"5000"	"4.6"	"<div jsname=""sngebd"">このアプリにお子さんの出産予定日を入力すると、お子さんがメンタルリープ (知能の成長期) に入って新たな知能が芽生える時期や、その影響でぐずりやすくなったり、大きな進歩が見られる時期があらかじめアプリ内カレンダーに表示されます。<br><br>メンタルリープは生後 20 ヶ月までに全部で 10 回訪れるのですが、その時期は赤ちゃんの週齢から予測できます。このアプリでは、メンタルリープを迎えるごとに赤ちゃんの頭の中でどんな変化が起きるのかを解説した上で、赤ちゃんの発達段階に応じた正しいケアやあやし方、遊び、知育を紹介しています。<br><br>※注: ワンダーウィークのカレンダーだけを見て、ぐずりの理由がメンタルリープ（健全な発達過程）だと判断するのは危険です。内容をよく読んでいただき、お子さんが泣きやまないなどの症状の原因が別にあることが懸念される場合は、お早めに医師にご相談ください。<br><br>※出産予定日や名前の入れ間違えなど、アプリの登録情報の変更方法やリープカレンダーの正しい使用法は「メンタルリープ研究所のブログ」をご覧ください。<br><br>【受賞歴】「Doctor Recommended App (お医者さんのおすすめアプリ)」「Best App Ever (歴代ベストアプリ)」「Coolest App for Moms (ママ向けの最もクールなアプリ)」など。<br><br>このアプリの主な内容:<br>- お子さんがメンタルリープ (ぐずり期) に入る時期を週齢単位で提示<br>- メンタルリープを経ることで芽生える知能を解説<br>- メンタルリープを経ることで可能となる行為の数々を紹介<br>- 赤ちゃんの週齢に合ったあやし方や成長の促し方を説明<br><br>このアプリはお子さんの脳が急激に発達してメンタルリープ (知能の成長期) を迎えるタイミングをリアルタイムに教えてくれます。赤ちゃんが感じている世界は、私たち大人が感じている世界と全く違います。そして各リープを迎えるたびに赤ちゃんには新たな知能が芽生え、そのせいで赤ちゃんの目の前の世界はガラリと変わって、私たち大人の世界に一歩近づくのです。その変化があまりにも急激で精神的に動揺するため、メンタルリープに入った赤ちゃんは必ず普段と比べて眠れなくなったり、食欲がなくなったり、夜泣きをしたり、ママにベッタリになったり、あるいはイライラしていることが多くなります。そのためこの時期はママやパパの育児の負担もかなり大きくなります。<br><br>※ワンダーウィークが役立っている方は是非ストアにレビューをいれて応援してください。またバグや問題を見つけた方は、こちらでは返信ができないため、技術サポート窓口 (wonderweeksjpn@gmail.com) までご連絡ください。<br><br>ワンダーウィーク (The Wonder Weeks) に対する声:<br><br>「赤ちゃんの心の中を覗けるとても興味深い内容です。お二人の観察研究と実践的な提案内容は素晴らしいと思います。」<br>ハーバード大学医学部名誉教授 T. ベリー・ブラゼルトン医学博士<br><br>「わが子のキレやすさ、親泣かせのだだごねは、実は脳の飛躍的発達（メンタルリープ）であると教えてくれるこの本は、日本の育児現場を救うでしょう。」<br>世界乳幼児精神保健学会理事・児童精神科医　渡辺久子先生<br><br>「只今、第4のメンタルリープでかまってちゃん。とことん付き合ってうつ伏せにしたり、部屋をうろついて、新しい世界を見せてあげると落ち着くので、当たってると思うし、理由を知ってるのは気分的にラク！」<br>あやめ母4Mbabyさん<br><br>「ワンダーウィークっていう赤ちゃんの成長過程を教えてれるアプリがあって、子供の名前と誕生日 (実際には出産予定日) を入力すると、自分の子に今起きていることを伝えてくれるんだ、イケてるだろ?」<br>米国人気ロックバンド・リンキンパークのジョーハーンさん (http://download.cnet.com/blog/download-blog/star-apps-linkin-park-57620777/)<br><br>【対象】<br>- 出産直後 ( 新生児 ) 〜１歳半の幼児を子育て中のママ、パパ、おじいちゃん、おばあちゃん<br>- 赤ちゃんの夜泣きやグズりに悩んでいるお母さんお父さん<br>- 難しい発達や育児の時期に入ったことを把握して子供や妻を助けてあげたい旦那さん<br>- 科学的根拠に基づいた正しい知育を実践したいお母さんお父さん<br>- 赤ちゃんが泣き止まなくて困っているお母さんお父さん<br>- 赤ちゃんの心が読めるようになりたい人<br>- 保育士、小児科医、ベビーマッサージ師、臨床心理士など乳幼児と関わる仕事をしている方<br>- 心理学者や科学者など新生児・乳幼児の発達を扱う研究者<br>- 妊娠中、特に出産予定日間近のママ Chcemy, żebyście przez te pierwsze 12 miesięcy głównie cieszyli się rodzicielstwem, bo rzetelną i praktyczną wiedzę o niemowlaku macie pod ręką!<br> <br>Rodzice malutkich dzieci bywają zagubieni z powodu natłoku informacji i porad dot. rodzicielstwa, dlatego zależało nam, żeby aplikacja Moje Dziecko dawała im wsparcie oraz praktyczną i rzetelną wiedzę. Opiekunem merytorycznym aplikacji Moje dziecko jest pediatra i mama dwójki dzieci, Ewa Miśko-Wąsowska.<br>Aplikacja została podzielona na wygodne w użyciu moduły: Rozwój, Dieta, Pielęgnacja oraz wzbogacona o funkcjonalność Siatki centylowe.<br><br>Rozwój<br>W tym module pokazujemy rodzicowi, jak przebiega rozwój jego dziecka miesiąc po miesiącu. Co może umieć 5-miesięczne niemowlę? Jak komunikuje się ze światem? Jak wspierać jego rozwój, a czego na pewno nie robić? Odpowiadamy na wszystkie pytania, na każdym etapie rozwoju malucha.<br><br>Dieta<br>Karmienie dziecka to kolejny niezwykle ważny obszar dla każdego rodzica. Wątpliwości dotyczą zarówno karmienia piersią, butelką czy rozszerzania diety. Dostarczymy rzetelną i pełną wiedzę w tym zakresie. I garść przepisów na smakołyki!<br><br>Pielęgnacja<br>Skóra maleństwa jest delikatna i wrażliwa, w związku z tym rodzice mają mnóstwo pytań o to, jak o nią dbać. Wybraliśmy (prawie) wszystkie rodzicielskie bolączki związane z kąpaniem, przewijaniem, pierwszym spacerem i podsunęliśmy proste oraz dobre patenty.<br><br>Siatki centylowe<br>Dzięki tej funkcjonalności w prosty w wygodny sposób rodzic może obserwować postępy rozwoju swojego dziecka na Siatkach centylowych. Wyniki pomiarów będą dostępne zarówno w formie wykresu (wagi i wzrostu) oraz listy ze wszystkimi pomiarami dziecka.<br><br>Momenty, czyli zachowuj najpiękniejsze i niezwykłe chwile z życia dziecka na zdjęciach i w swoich wspomnieniach.<br><br>Momenty są ułożone chronologicznie. Co jeszcze lepiej oddaje, jak Twoje dziecko rośnie i rozwija się z miesiąca na miesiąc. A Tobie pozwoli umieścić rodzicielską podróż w czasie.<br><br>Zdjęcia wraz ze wspomnieniami możesz przechowywać w praktycznych Albumach: Kuchnia, Zabawa, Podróż, Sen, Sukcesy oraz tworzyć własne Albumy.<br><br>Pojedyncze Momenty oraz całe Albumy możesz udostępniać gronu najbliższych osób drogą mailową.<br><br><br>Porada lekarska. Po wybraniu objawu choroby rodzic dowiaduje się, jak postępować z dzieckiem i co może być przyczyną objawu. "preschool.learning.tips"	"Preschool Learning Tips for Parents"	"10"	"0"	"<div jsname=""sngebd"">Preschool learning for parents Activities-Emotional Development &amp; Fine Motor Skills Activities, Preschool learning activities are varied and just involve a little creativity. Emotional Development activities for kids as well as Fine Motor Skills Development are very important areas to develop in your child or preschooler.<br><br>In this app inlcude:<br><br>preschool learning for parents<br>preschool learning activities<br>preschool curriculum<br><br>Features of the app:<br><br>Support Offline App<br>Updated regularly<br>You can ask questions from our experts<br>Sharing tips and guide<br>Simple app book guide like pocket on your phone<br>You can also send us your suggestions and we will add them inside the app.<br><br>Preschool learning for parents Include simple explain:<br><br>Having your preschool child cut out various shapes and objects is a great way to help develop fine motor skills. Of course if you are going to allow your children or preschoolers to do this activity you need to ensure they are using the proper 'child safe' scissors when doing ANY cutting in any material.  <br><br>Here is a fun preschool learning activity that you can use with your preschool child to help develop them in these specific areas of growth. Keep a collection of old magazines, newspapers or flyers that are full of images of people with different expressions etc.<br><br>Instruct the children to pick a magazine or newspaper etc. to look through and find images of people's faces showing different expressions.  They may find pictures of happy faces, sad faces, surprised faces, angry faces, scared faces and many more.    <br><br>Your preschool child can then 'cut out' all the faces they find using 'child safe' scissors of course, and they can discuss each different image with the parent or teacher and discuss what they see in the person's expression.  You could even just have children find and cut out a certain expression, or what 'they' see as a certain expression. For example, you could tell them to find any pictures of 'happy faces' and see what they come up with, you may be surprised what they find!  <br><br>It is good to keep these images and glue them to a piece of Bristol Board or construction paper, and then to laminate it. You can then cut them all out and save them in a box or envelope! This will make the images last for years so they may be used again and again in many different ways to teach children.  You could even use these different faces and expressions and have children 'GROUP' all similar expressions together in a pile.  <br><br>Another Great learning activity for children becoming familiar with spelling and simple reading or word recognition would be to have a few different images (4-6) out. You could then have the names of the expressions written on a piece of paper or a label (example) Happy, Sad, Angry etc. You could have the child(ren) match the image to the word. This is excellent for simple reading and recognition of every day words that express emotion.<br><br>Download Preschool learning  app now for learn about preschool learning for parents</div>"	"0.00"	"Parenting"	"0"

Baby Monitor will help you in this! Baby Monitor will call you if your child wakes up or specified noise level will be exceeded. It works without Internet. You can also use this app as a (noise) SPL meter<br><br>Briefly the main features:<br>- work on the 2 (dual) SIM phones<br>- you can select SIM-card slot for making calls<br>- function ""Call Me Back""<br>- pause at start and after alarm/call<br>- Two-way (loud) talkback<br>- turning on the speakerphone delay<br>- microphone sensitivity adjustment<br>- auto silent mode<br><br>Advantages:<br>- No advertising<br>- Pause after alarm<br>- Fine-tuning alarm noise level<br>- Low battery consumption<br>- Delayed start<br>- Does not require Internet<br>- It does not require a second phone to be a smartphone<br><br>Tips before you start to use:<br>- The phone receiving a call from the Baby Monitor can be any phone<br>- Ensure that the device has enough power (or better yet leave on charge)<br>- A call is made immediately, without select the SIM dialogue or the method call<br>- Set the phone at a distance of less than 2m from the child<br>- It is desirable to test the application multiple times<br><br>To start the Meri Baby Monitor/Radio Nanny configure it. To do this, click the Settings button.<br><br>Select a phone number from the phone book or enter it with the keyboard. This is the number to which calls will be received from the radio nanny when the surrounding noise exceeds the preset level.<br><br>Adjust the noise level to the desired parameter. To be able to quietly leave the baby alarm area after its launch switch on the Pause at startup. Note that this pause will also be applied after each alarm or incoming/outgoing call.<br><br>During an active call the speakerphone can be turned on. Just enable this option in the settings. So you can listen to surrounding sounds in the room where the baby sleeps and the ability speak soothing words to a child through the phone.<br><br>Do you want to know what is currently happening in the room where the child? Just call on the phone with the Baby monitor app from the number, which is specified in the settings. Radio Nanny will call you back immediately, within a few seconds!<br><br>Would you like automatically switch to silent mode when the application starts? Simply activate this option in the settings. Thus, incoming calls to your phone, where works Mary Baby Monitor, will have not vibrate or loud playing of a ringtone. If you are planning on having your baby in a hospital or midwife led unit with no internet, we also provide a link (within the app) to download the tracks onto your computer, and load them into your own listening device. <br><br>We recommend listening to Christian Hypnobirthing at least two to three times a week from 30 weeks, and as often as every day from 36 weeks. Don’t worry if you are further along, however, as there are benefits regardless of how many times you listen to it. <br><br>One of the main causes of pain during childbirth is fear. Fear causes your body to release hormones that block endorphins, which are your body’s natural pain relievers. Fear can also cause your muscles to tense up, making the opening of the body in labour harder and therefore more painful. Being in a state of faith, love and strength can help you to overcome fear and as a result, birth can be a more satisfying, joyful and empowered experience. Listening to Christian Hypnobirthing can help you to come into this faith filled state, but also being well informed about the different stages of labour and early parenthood, can help you feel more prepared, confident and relaxed about the birthing process.
